tool.name: expand_sbb
tool.displayname: 2: Expand Site Building Blocks with Core Area

param.name: in_Cores
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class representing habitat cores to be used to expand SBB boundaries

param.name: in_SBB
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class containing original Site Building Blocks

param.name: in_PF
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class containing Procedural Features whence SBBs were derived.

param.name: joinFld
param.dialogReference: The name of the field containing the unique ID linking SBBs to their corresponding PFs. This field name must be the same in both feature classes.

param.name: out_SBB
param.dialogReference: Output feature class containing expanded Site Building Blocks encompassing additional core habitat area.

param.name: scratch_GDB
param.dialogReference:
Scratch geodatabase specified to store temporary/intermediate data.

If not specified, intermediate data will be stored in memory and will not persist; this is preferred for faster processing. It is recommended that you only specify a scratch geodatabase if you need to trouble-shoot poor automation results, or if your computer has insufficient memory for processing large datasets.

tool.summary:
Expands existing Site Building Blocks (SBBs) with core habitat area, where applicable.

  • SBBs for which the corresponding Procedural Features (PFs) do not intersect any core will remain unaltered in the output.

  • SBBs for features associated with man-made openings (SBB Rule #1) will remain unaltered in the output.

idCitation.resTitle: 2: Expand Site Building Blocks with Core Area

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Expands existing Site Building Blocks (SBBs) with core habitat area, where applicable.

  • SBBs for which the corresponding Procedural Features (PFs) do not intersect any core will remain unaltered in the output.

  • SBBs for features associated with man-made openings (SBB Rule #1) will remain unaltered in the output.
